Description: Tall narrow jar of dull pink pottery: with a roll rim around a contracted mouth. Below the rim is an incised line. The sides widen from the rim to the shoulder, then converge to a narrow, rounded base. Smoothed interior. Good condition.
Curator's comments: Cf. W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Ceremonial Slate Palettes and Corpus of Protodynastic Pottery’ (London, 1953), 60d-n, 60r-t. Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 13; W.V.Davies (ed.), 'Egypt and Africa : Nubia from prehistory to Islam' (London, 1991) [PL.13.1]; 'Nubia - Los Reinos del Nilo en Sudàn' [Exhibit catalogue] (2003). "Recipiente" p. 144, Cat. No. 46.
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p17)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2003 10 Apr-31 Aug, Barcelona, CaixaForum, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan 2003/4 23 Sep-4 Jan, Madrid, Sala de Exposiciones de la Fundacio, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan
